info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 30 at 3:46AM PST until December 02 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 4 AM PST FRIDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory above 4000 feet, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 9 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch above 4000 feet, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 36 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph over exposed terrain. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Cascades above 4000 feet elevation from near highway 140 northward. This includes Lake of the Woods, Crater Lake, Willamette Pass and Diamond Lake Junction. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 10 AM Thursday to 4 AM PST Friday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from 4 am Friday through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall totals will be lowest farther south near highway 140. The highest totals will be around Crater Lake and northward. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties. * A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow accumulations that may create dangerous travel. * Plan now to avoid traveling during the storm. Do not detour during winter storms.
